Utility Edition | January 15, 2014
Confidential & Proprietary
Itron 100W+ Transition Update
We are happy to announce the 100W+ is now shipping and order lead times should return to normal. Only a limited number of 100W ERTs remain and will be used to fulfill orders based on availability and configuration. Please make sure you have notified your 100W customers of the transition to 100W+ ERTs so they may prepare their utility systems accordingly. Please refer to the November 15, 2013 utility eNews for more information.
Please contact Sheila Nally if you have any questions.
ORION® CE Ranger 3 Handheld Production Hold
The ORION CE Ranger 3 handheld is on production hold due to a component issue that reduces RF reading performance. We will advise you as soon as the production hold is lifted. This hold does NOT apply to ORION ME and manual read handhelds, and they are shipping as normal.
We will provide regular updates. Thank you for your patience and understanding, and we sincerely apologize for any inconvenience this has caused.
Please contact Sheila Nally if you have any questions.
Itron FC300 Ordering Guide
An Itron FC300 Handheld Ordering Guide is now available on the Badger Meter Extranet! This guide will assist you when determining what parts need to be included when ordering an FC300 handheld.
Please download the complete ordering guide here.
Please contact Sheila Nally if you have any questions.
New 2014 Marketing Programs
New Marketing Programs for 2014 will be announced at the National Sales Meeting. Pricing for the 2013 programs are valid through February, 2014 with Badger Meter account manager and/or channel manager approval.
Please contact Sheila Nally if you have any questions.

Announcement: Morrice Blackwell -
New Product Sales & Market Development Manager
Starting February 1, 2014, Morrice Blackwell will join the utility sales team in the role of new product sales and market development manager. This is a new position within utility sales and is responsible for the support and development of utility sales strategies and plans to grow the sales of both new products and services into established accounts, new accounts and new markets. He will be working closely with the direct Badger Meter sales team and distributors to meet or exceed annual sales goals of new products and services.
Morrice is coming to the sales team from his current role as marketing manager with Badger Meter. Morrice has held several positions within Badger Meter starting in 1994 and will be a valuable addition to the sales team. His experience and expertise will help drive success and meet the sales goals of Badger Meter utility new products and services.
Please take a moment and congratulate Morrice on his new role!
Introducing: Kristie Anderson - Sr. Product Marketing Manager
We are pleased to introduce Kristie Anderson, who joins Badger Meter as senior product marketing manager with the utility marketing group. Kristie brings a strong background and over twenty years of experience in product marketing, strategic planning and marketing management. Kristie previously held a variety of marketing positions at Phoenix Products Company in Milwaukee, WI. She will be managing all AMI/AMR technologies for Badger Meter utility products.
Kristie received her Bachelor of Business Administration from the University of Wisconsin-Madison. Kristie lives in Germantown, WI with her husband, Mike. Cheering for her two sons in hockey helps the winter pass quickly, and their chocolate lab provides daily comic relief.
Please take a moment to welcome Kristie to Badger Meter!
Announcement: Jan Boyer Promoted to Marketing Manager, Utility Metering
We are pleased to announce that Jan Boyer has been promoted to marketing manager, utility metering. As a marketing manager, Jan will be responsible for developing and implementing strategies for the successful sale and promotion of our metering products. Jan has held multiple positions within Badger Meter marketing, contracts, technical support, and purchasing. Her diverse background within the company and knowledge and understanding of the utility market has positioned her well for her new position.
Please take a moment to congratulate Jan on her promotion!
